column166: Parking Spaces Add'l to Main Unit
column183: "The architectural preservation district is established to preserve, protect, enhance and maintain the architectural excellence and historic importance of the Colonial Williamsburg historic area, and to recognize other areas of the city having historic, architectural and cultural significance. These regulations are intended to create an atmosphere for compatible future growth, to prevent the intrusion of adverse environmental influences, to ensure that new structures and uses will be in keeping with the character of the district, and to encourage a diversity of architectural style."

column166: Parking Spaces Add'l to Main Unit
column183: The archaeological protection district is established to ensure that archaeological resources in the city are studied and, based on the findings of the study, that significant resources are either preserved or recovered through a resource management plan.

column166: Parking Spaces Add'l to Main Unit
column183: Per § 21-234, "Residential uses in conjunction with a new development or major redevelopment of a property, but not including the reuse of existing buildings..." may be permitted with a special use permit. This includes multifamily, provided that not more than 67 percent of gross floor area on any lot may be devoted to multifamily use and non-residential floor area shall be constructed simultaneously. Townhouses may be developed similarly. Max density is 14 units/net acre.

column166: Parking Spaces Add'l to Main Unit
column183: Per § 21-354, multifamily dwellings may be permitted with a special use permit, "provided that not more than 67 percent of the gross floor area of any new buildings on any lot may be devoted to multifamily use. The gross floor area may be increased up to 80 percent if a special use permit is approved by the city council. Non-residential floor area shall be constructed simultaneously with the construction of the multifamily floor area." Senior housing as defined in accordance with § 21-2 may be permitted with a special use permit.

column166: Parking Spaces Add'l to Main Unit
column183: In accordance with § 21-334, multifamily dwellings may be allowed in conjunction with new development or major development with a special use permit, provided that not more than 67 percent of the gross floor area on any lot may be devoted to multifamily use. Nonresidential floor area shall be constructed simultaneously.

column166: Parking Spaces Add'l to Main Unit
column183: "The corridor protection district is established to protect and enhance the historic character of the Colonial Williamsburg historic area and the architectural preservation district by ensuring that the major access corridors to these areas are developed and maintained in a harmonious and compatible manner. This district is also intended to encourage the improvement of the architectural and visual character of these major corridors, and to encourage a diversity of architectural style that is compatible with the character of the architectural preservation district."

column183: Restoration/reconstruction of single-family detached homes constructed prior to 1800 is permitted.

column183: In accordance with § 21-482, only allows for student designed dwellings. PDC districts shall be permitted only on land designated as downtown commercial land use in the adopted comprehensive plan.

column183: PDH districts shall be permitted only in the B-2 zoning district. Provides for "Adaptive housing" (i.e. efficiency and one-bedroom units from all or part of an existing hotel/motel, and used for the purpose of providing non-permanent, affordable and flexible-term housing for individuals and families.
